Content: He pointed to a smallish, dark, well-dressed man who was bustling along the other side of the road. As we watched him he looked across at a boy who was bawling out the latest edition of the evening paper, and running over among the cabs and busses, he bought one from him. Then, clutching it in his hand, he vanished through a door-way.
Source: The Greatest Cases of Sherlock Holmes, The Stockbroker's Clerk
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle
